subclassFeature.name: Arcane Marksman
entries: An Arcane Marksman studies a unique method of archery that weaves magic into attacks to produce supernatural effects. These techniques are the favorite of a variety of expert marksmen, including elite elven sentinels, dwarven gnoll hunters, and a number of well-known mercenaries. These fighters can turn a simple arrow, bolt or even sling bullet into a vessel for magic that harms and debilitates their enemies. Requiring both a mastery of ranged combat and an understanding of the arcane arts, Arcane Marksmen stand out as versatile and effective sharpshooters.

entries.name: Arcane Marksman vs Arcane Archer
entries: This subclass is a replacement of the Arcane Archer presented in {@i Xanathar's Guide to Everything}, which dissatisfied me in a number of significant ways, including being bow-only and having highly limited usages of its core identifying feature. So, I designed this to fix my issues with the subclass, and polished up some other aspects along the way, as well as genericizing the flavor away from being elf-centric. Here's some of my thoughts on the changes I've made, which also serves as a changelog from the XGE version:
Name switched to Arcane Marksman to distinguish from the regular XGE version and to make the archetype more clearly not restricted to bows.
I assume the elven lore connection is a Forgotten Realms thing. I've gone and made the archetype setting agnostic. This is also why they get just Arcana proficiency rather than nature/arcana.

Magic Arrow and Arcane Shot were combined into one feature, as they were not really that seperate anyway. The bows-only restriction has been lifted (here and in subsequent features), as that was pretty much totally arbitrary. Now you can have arcane crossbowmen and slingers too.

Number of arcane shots per rest was increased to Intelligence Modifier, to promote investing in Int and also promote use of the Arcane Archer's iconic feature. This also means that the extra damage per shot needs to be lower than with 2/rest, so I've bumped them down to {@dice 1d6}/{@dice 2d6}.
60ft on Curving Shot seemed kind of excessive, I think 30ft fits the flavor a bit better without signifcantly impacting the power level.
Ever-Ready Shot was buffed, since you now have more uses but each individual shot is weaker. Also added an ammo ribbon to it.

The original subclass was missing a 10th level feature (regardless of what the designers say on Twitter), so Forceful Shot was added. The feature is not directly useful to you (disadvantage on ranged vs prone), but adds anti-flying and teamwork utility.
All references to "arrows" were changed to "shot" to allow any ammunition to be used.
Piercing Shot's extra damage was flipped to Force (ironically, given its name) as it seems more fitting for an ethereal attack.
Seeking Shot's extra damage was flipped to Piercing, as Force damage seemed unfitting for a divination effect.

subclassFeature.name: Basic Arcana
entries: At 3rd level, studying the techniques required to produce your arcane shots has taught you basic magic. You gain proficiency in {@skill Arcana}, and learn the {@spell prestidigitation} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the ability to infuse your shots with magic. Whenever you fire a nonmagical piece of ammunition from a ranged weapon, you can make it magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. The magic fades from the shot immediately after it hits or misses its target.

Additionally, you learn two Arcane Shot options of your choice (see the "Arcane Shot Options" section). Once per turn when you fire a magical piece of ammunition from a ranged weapon as part of the {@action Attack} action, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that shot. You decide to use the option when the attack hits a creature, unless the option doesn't involve an attack roll. You have a number of uses of this ability equal to your Intelligence modifier, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach certain levels in this class: 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level. Each option also improves when you become an 18th-level fighter.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot Options
entries: The Arcane Shot feature lets you choose options for it at certain levels. The options are presented here in alphabetical order. They are all magical effects, and each one is associated with one of the schools of magic.
If an option requires a saving throw, your Arcane Shot save DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Curving Shot
entries: At 7th level, you learn how to direct an errant shot toward a new target. When you make an attack roll with a magical piece of ammunition and miss, you can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 30 feet of the original target.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: At 7th level, you learn another Arcane Shot option of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: At 10th level, you learn another Arcane Shot option of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: At 15th level, you learn another Arcane Shot option of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: At 18th level, you learn another Arcane Shot option of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Forceful Shot
entries: Beginning at 10th level, when you hit a creature with an Arcane Shot, you can spend an additional use of Arcane Shot to knock the target {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Ever-Ready Shot
entries: Starting at 15th level, your marksmanship is always ready for a fight. When you roll initiative, you regain one use of Arcane Shot. If you have no uses remaining, you regain two uses of it instead.

Additionally, you can conjure 30 pieces of ammunition as a bonus action, which disappear after 1 minute. You choose the type of ammunition, which is magical, and appears in your quiver or equivalent container.

optionalfeature.name: Banishing Shot
entries: You use abjuration magic to try to temporarily banish your target from this plane. If the shot hits a creature, the target must also succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished in this way, its speed is 0, and it is {@condition incapacitated}. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
After you reach 18th level in this class, a target also takes {@dice 1d6} force damage when the shot hits it.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Shot
entries: Your enchantment magic causes this shot to temporarily beguile its target. Choose one of your allies within 30 feet of the target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@dice 1d6} psychic damage, and must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or it is {@condition charmed} by the chosen ally until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if the chosen ally attacks the {@condition charmed} target, deals damage to it, or forces it to make a saving throw.
The psychic damage increases to {@dice 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Bursting Shot
entries: You imbue your shot with force energy drawn from the school of evocation. The energy detonates after your attack. Immediately after the shot hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take {@dice 1d6} force damage each.
The force damage increases to {@dice 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Enfeebling Shot
entries: You weave necromantic magic into your shot. The creature hit by the shot takes an extra {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the damage dealt by its weapon attacks is halved until the start of your next turn.
The necrotic damage increases to {@dice 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Shot
entries: When this shot strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, poisonous brambles, which wrap around the target. The creature hit by the shot takes an extra {@dice 1d6} poison damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it takes {@dice 1d6} slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can reach it can use its action to remove the brambles with a successful Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your Arcane Shot save DC. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute or until you use this arcane shot option again.
The poison and slashing damage both increase to {@dice 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Shot
entries: You use transmutation magic to give your shot an ethereal quality. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the shot fires forward in a line that is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The shot passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes damage as if it were hit by the shot, plus an extra {@dice 1d6} force damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
The force damage increases to {@dice 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Shot
entries: Using divination magic, you grant your shot the ability to seek out your target. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, choose one creature you have seen in the past minute. The shot flies toward that creature, moving around corners if necessary and ignoring three-quarters cover and half cover. If the target is within the weapon's range and there is a path large enough for the shot to travel to the target, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes damage as if it were hit by the shot, plus an extra {@dice 1d6} piercing damage, and you learn the target's current location. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and you don't learn its location.
The piercing damage increases to {@dice 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Shot
entries: You weave illusion magic into your shot, causing it to occlude your foe's vision with shadows. The creature hit by the shot takes an extra {@dice 1d6} psychic damage, and must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away from itself until the start of your next turn.
The psychic damage increases to {@dice 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.
